snippet: The court heard arguments Tuesday in a rabbi’s case against Northwest Airlines, which revoked his membership in its frequent flier program. A federal law limits the kind of suits travelers may file.
abstract: Supreme Court hears arguments in Rabbi S Binyomin Ginsberg's case against Northwest Airlines, which revoked his membership in its frequent flier program; at issue is a federal law that limits the kind of suits travelers may file against airlines.
lead_paragraph: The court heard arguments Tuesday in a rabbi’s case against Northwest Airlines, which revoked his membership in its frequent flier program. A federal law limits the kind of suits travelers may file.

headline.main: Supreme Court Considers Frequent Flier Contracts
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Considers Frequent Flier Contracts
